I can assure you that as far as this, if it were not for the principle involved, this case would never be here, Your Honor.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: But you would be making the same argument whether the -- suppose that this individual was a Greek or an American, wouldn't you?

turn.speaker: james_m_estabrook
turn.label: Mr. James M. Estabrook
turn.text: On this ship, yes.
I'd say that --

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: So it's really irrelevant about the allegiance of the majority stockholder of this corporation, your argument would be the same?

turn.speaker: james_m_estabrook
turn.label: Mr. James M. Estabrook
turn.text: That's right.
In fact the McCulloch case says it is the same.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: And you're -- and the owner of the ship anyway is a Panamanian corporation?

turn.speaker: james_m_estabrook
turn.label: Mr. James M. Estabrook
turn.text: All of the stock of which is owned by a Greek Corporation.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: By a Greek Corporation and 99% of which is owned by --

turn.speaker: james_m_estabrook
turn.label: Mr. James M. Estabrook
turn.text: A Greek citizen domiciled in this country.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: But those things are really irrelevant, aren't they, to your argument because as long as the ship is registered in Greece --

turn.speaker: james_m_estabrook
turn.label: Mr. James M. Estabrook
turn.text: That's right.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: -- carrying the foreign flag and a Greek crew --

turn.speaker: james_m_estabrook
turn.label: Mr. James M. Estabrook
turn.text: Yes.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: -- it's irrelevant to your argument who the owner is.

turn.speaker: james_m_estabrook
turn.label: Mr. James M. Estabrook
turn.text: That's -- yes, that follows the argument in the McCulloch.
Now, in Larsen against Lauritzen, the allegiance of the owner, the fact the owner is a Greek citizen is important and the same way in the Romero case which followed --

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: You say there are no such things as flags of convenience.

turn.speaker: james_m_estabrook
turn.label: Mr. James M. Estabrook
turn.text: I say there are many flags of convenience but this isn't one of them.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: This isn't one of them because --

turn.speaker: james_m_estabrook
turn.label: Mr. James M. Estabrook
turn.text: Because of the fact the Greek Government is responsible for the good order and maintenance of the ship.
They have a Greek crew on board this ship.
They have Greek licensed officers.
They have Greek inspections.
This is a bona fide Greek operation.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: And that -- and that anybody from anywhere around the world can go and --

turn.speaker: james_m_estabrook
turn.label: Mr. James M. Estabrook
turn.text: No, no.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: And get -- and get their ships that are -- that may be built abroad, owned abroad and licensed in Greece?

turn.speaker: james_m_estabrook
turn.label: Mr. James M. Estabrook
turn.text: No, Your Honor.
The Greek law set forth in my brief requires over 50% of the stock ownership of a corporation with a Greek flag ship being Greek.
That's right in there.

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: It is not true here though, is it?

turn.speaker: james_m_estabrook
turn.label: Mr. James M. Estabrook
turn.text: Yes, it is.

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: I thought you said 99% was owned by one man who lives in this country --

turn.speaker: james_m_estabrook
turn.label: Mr. James M. Estabrook
turn.text: And is a Greek citizen.

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: And 1% by his son.

turn.speaker: james_m_estabrook
turn.label: Mr. James M. Estabrook
turn.text: No, I will say that 99% --

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: What?

turn.speaker: james_m_estabrook
turn.label: Mr. James M. Estabrook
turn.text: I will say that 99% was owned by one man --

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: In this country?

turn.speaker: james_m_estabrook
turn.label: Mr. James M. Estabrook
turn.text: A Greek citizen with allegiance to Greece.
He's a Greek citizen.

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: But he lives in this country.

turn.speaker: james_m_estabrook
turn.label: Mr. James M. Estabrook
turn.text: Yes, he does.

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: And did his business in this country?

turn.speaker: james_m_estabrook
turn.label: Mr. James M. Estabrook
turn.text: Yes, but he is a Greek citizen.

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: Had been living here many years?

turn.speaker: james_m_estabrook
turn.label: Mr. James M. Estabrook
turn.text: Yes, Your Honor.

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: May I ask you just one other question about the contract?

Suppose the Government -- the federal law did govern our law, when this man was to make his contract, they have said, "Well, you got to sign this contract which agrees that we will not owe you any money under your American law," would that have been valid under America?

turn.speaker: james_m_estabrook
turn.label: Mr. James M. Estabrook
turn.text: Under the Jones Act, it would not be valid.

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: It would not be valid.

turn.speaker: james_m_estabrook
turn.label: Mr. James M. Estabrook
turn.text: There's a specific provision of the Jones Act.

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: That's right.

turn.speaker: james_m_estabrook
turn.label: Mr. James M. Estabrook
turn.text: Yes.

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: Alright, that's I wanted to know.
